results.title: Down to the sea
results.creator_credit: Fisheries Research Board of Canada, ONF | NFB and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: Opening with the poignant story of a herring fisherman whose life’s work is endangered by man’s careless exploitation of the living resources of the sea, this film looks at the frontiers of technology in fisheries research. Emphasises the use of undersea technology, including scuba diving, underwater sleds, and a new two-man submarine of revolutionary design.

results.title: Down to Sussex
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: South Down and Weald - open space and green woodland. This is Sussex, a county rich in scenic beauty. History shows itself everywhere, right back to the threshold of legend - The Long Man of Wilmington and Chanctonbury Ring. All this the present day traveller can see and enjoy, together with the present day delights of Petworth Show, Goodwood Races, polo at Cowdray Park, Glyndebourne and the Sussex Coast. Narrated by Peter Halliday.

results.title: Down to earth city living
results.brief_description: Depicts the alternative energy sources used at the Integral Urban House in Berkeley, California to transform a typical urban residence into an almost self-sufficient habitat. Shows how solar energy is integrated into the house to provide economical and efficient heating; how the roof and backyard are utilised optimally to furnish the dwellers with a year round supply of vegetables; and how organic waste is recycled and transformed into plant nutrients for use in the garden. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Down to Earth
results.brief_description: Kevin Handreck, a CSIRO researcher for over 30 years and author of the highly successful books, “Discovering Soil”, stars in this video produced in conjunction with “Gardening Australia”. He covers the treatment of clay soil, planting out from containers, making compost, the importance of soil pH, potting mixes, the importance of earthworms, hydroponics, pot plant care, effective watering and watering systems, the care of lawns, prevention of soil-borne diseases and selecting the correct fertiliser.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Films (Australia), Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and David Morgan
results.brief_description: Shows how a large city such as Melbourne disposes of its enormous amount of waste water every day. Looks at the processes involved in sewage treatment and in particular, the work carried out at the Werribee Sewage Treatment Farm. Narrated by Charles Tingwell. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: A United Nations Productions, Gilbert Lauzun and Paul Klee
results.brief_description: Since the space age began, the U.N. has been concerned with using “outer space” technology for the benefit of the developing, as well as the advanced nations. As examples of peaceful applications of the new technology, the film shows how orbiting satellites bring instructional television to India, survey a rain forest and search the Altiplano for minerals in Bolivia and monitor a typhoon in the Phillippines.

results.title: Down to earth
results.creator_credit: Eady-Barnes Productions and Training Films International
results.brief_description: The film portrays “lucky” Joe, an electrician, in several hazardous situations, each potentially lethal. Joe’s enthusiasm for providing power and tools to whoever should require them, or to do electrical repair work himself, is not equalled by his observance of the strict site safety rules with the result that he puts many others as well as himself into considerable danger.

results.title: Down through the years: a random view of Montreal
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marcel Martin, Victor Jobin and Jacques Giraldeau
results.brief_description: A poetic view of Montreal. To the rhythm of excerpts from ‘Jazz Sebastian Bach’ by the Swingle Singers - a vocal group from France - the camera explores the old city and the new. In the city modern skyscrapers mushroom skywards, but all around are ancient streets and monuments jealously guarding the memories of another time: including Bonsecours Church, La Place Royal, Le Theatre des Saltimbanques and Dickens Street.

results.title: Down there = alli abajo (Spanish version)
results.brief_description: Using both animation and interviews with women from many different cultural backgrounds, this program attempts to break down the myths and dispel the fears and misinformation about women’s bodily functions. Presents information about reproduction, preventative health care and contraception.
